newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAB shares remain weak on flat results.
newsitem.headline: SAB shares remain weak on flat results.

text.p: Shares in South African Breweries Ltd were off the day's lows on Tuesday but still down 325 cents at 130.00 rand by 1310 GMT after the industrial giant unveiled lacklustre year results, dealers said.
Diluted earnings per share came in at 605.3 cents versus 540.8, below the consensus of analysts polled by Reuters of 617.8 cents.
"They came out with 605 on a diluted basis. Most people had been looking for around 620, or 625. I think after they have looked at it now, people are not very happy," said one dealer.
The market had been bracing for disappointing figures from the brewing-to-retail giant and the shares had earlier touched a low of 129.00 on nervousness ahead of the figures.
